title: Robert Pattinson reveals grim preparation for film The Lighthouse
text:
Oh RPatz, what won’t you do for a role (Picture: WireImage)

So it seems Robert Pattinson is willing to go the extra length for his craft, after he revealed his grim preparation for his latest film The Lighthouse.

The Twilight star revealed he ate mud in order to get into character, doing some pretty weird stuff an hour before shooting the scenes.

That’s right, he was ‘growling and licking up puddles of mud’, apparently.

That’s dedication.

His latest film, alongside Willem Dafoe, is set in 1890, with Robert playing lighthouse apprentice Ephraim Winslow.

Now speaking about his role, the 33-year-old revealed more than we could ever imagine as he described ‘playing a mad person’.

‘It means you can sort of be mad the whole time. Well, not the whole time, but for like an hour before the scene,’ he explained to Esquire magazine recently.

Going further to give the people what they want, Robert said he was ‘basically unconscious the whole time’ while filming moments his character is drunk off kerosene, which seems like an easy day on the job.

‘It was crazy,’ Robert went on. ‘I spent so much time making myself throw up. Pissing my pants. It’s the most revolting thing. I don’t know, maybe it’s really annoying.’

Maybe.

It wasn’t all urinating on himself and throwing up, though, as he added he also spent time spinning around in circles before takes to really get into the mad man mentality, while also putting rocks in his shoes – which is enough to send anyone around the bend.

Rob stars alongside Willem

Robert puts his sanity on the line however his thoughts on getting into character comes after he admitted he was sick of ‘masturbating’ in films.

While recently discussing recurring themes in his movies, the star moaned that he’s constantly being told to pleasure himself on camera. Which – considering it’s happened in four of Rob’s movies – is kind of a fair point.

‘I keep masturbating. In the last three or four movies, I’ve got a masturbation scene,’ the Twilight star told Variety magazine.

‘I did it in High Life. I did it in Damsel. And The Devil All the Time. I only realised when I did it the fourth time.’

Being an actor – it’s a hard knock life.

The Lighthouse is in UK cinemas 31 January, 2020.
